title: Styled
description: An abstract base class for a document node that has styling applied to it and/or its content.
$comment:
This class is very similar to the `Math` abstract base class but has `styleLanguage` instead
of `mathLanguage` and compiled `css` instead of `mathml`.

Note also that `styleLanguage` is optional.

type.$comment: This is a special property analogous to JSON-LD's `@type` keyword.

id.$comment: This is a special property analogous to JSON-LD's `@id` keyword.

code.description: The code of the equation in the `styleLanguage`.

min.description: Generate a simple fixed string of code.

low.description: Generate a random string of up to 10 alphanumeric & whitespace characters.

high.description: Generate a random string of up to 100 characters (excluding control characters).

styleLanguage.description: The language used for the style specification e.g. css, tw

min.description: Do not generate a style language.

low.description: Generate one of the well known style language short names.

high.description: Generate a random string of up to 10 alphanumeric characters.

authors.description: The authors of the styling code.

compilationDigest.$comment: Used to avoid unnecessary transpilation to CSS.

compilationMessages.description: Messages generated while parsing and transpiling the style.

css.description: A Cascading Style Sheet (CSS) transpiled from the `code` property.

classList.description: A space separated list of class names associated with the node.
classList.$comment:
Analogous to the [`classList` property of an `Element`](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/API/Element/classList)
in the Web API.
